page.title: 08St Mary's Parish Church
page.content: Temple Balsall belonged to the Knights Templars as early as 1146.There was probably a chapel on the site then.By 1338 the Knights of St John were living there .They left in the 1470s,and the church was allowed to decay for more than 100 years. Eventually the manor was owned by Robert Dudley, Earl of Leicester.His grandaughters,Lady Anne Holbourne and Lady Katherine Leveson began to restore the church.Lady Katherine also left money to set up an almshouse and school.The minister was also Master of the Hospital and teacher of the boys.A second restoration took place in 1845. St Mary's Church was made a parish church in 1863.
